ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of obesity, short metacarpals (especially 4th and 5th), and intellectual disability. This is the hallmark presentation of AHO/PHP1A.
Same as AHO - presents with Albright hereditary osteodystrophy phenotype including obesity, brachydactyly with short metacarpals, and cognitive impairment.
Features obesity and intellectual disability prominently, but short metacarpals are not a typical feature. Small hands and feet are common but different from isolated short metacarpals.
Presents with obesity and intellectual disability, can have brachydactyly, but typically has additional features like retinal dystrophy and polydactyly not mentioned here.
Features obesity (typically truncal) and intellectual disability, can have short metacarpals, but usually has distinctive facial features and progressive retinopathy.
Can present with AHO phenotype similar to PHP1A but with resistance to multiple hormones. Less common than PHP1A.
Can present with obesity, intellectual disability, and brachydactyly including short metacarpals, particularly of the 3rd-5th digits.
